item.title: Jimmy Barnes, Dave Faulkner among music industry voices in open letter urging ANU to keep School of Music
item.description: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

item.title: Man admits he claimed to be Charlie Kirk gunman so real suspect could flee
item.description: US police have charged a 71-year-old man they say has admitted to yelling out that he shot conservative activist Charlie Kirk in order to "allow the actual suspect to flee".

item.title: Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health clinic, the Hobart Clinic, to close inpatient site by end of October
item.description: The Hobart Clinic, which employs 100 people and has provided private mental health services for Tasmanians for 40 years, will close its inpatient site by the end of October, citing financial woes.

item.title: Hawks AFL coach Sam Mitchell reacts to speculation over Zach Merrett meeting
item.description: As his young Hawks squad prepare for their preliminary final against the Cats, Sam Mitchell opens up about the club's pursuit of Bombers captain Zach Merrett.

item.title: Police search for alleged Cairns shooter John Durham Willey after car crash
item.description: Officers allege a man shot a man in the leg in Cairns earlier this month, and was involved in a traffic incident north of Rockhampton.

item.title: Panthers reflect on how Knights loss fuelled run to NRL semifinals
item.description: The Panthers were last on the ladder after round 12, but a "brutal reality check" helped fuel the four-time defending premier's run to this season's finals series.

item.title: Does the damning planning report mean the end for Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium?
item.description: The Tasmanian Planning Commission described the Hobart stadium as a "singular, large, bulky monolith" with "optimism bias" in the government's cost-benefit figures. What does this mean for the stadium?

item.title: Toucans and other exotic animals rescued in major Brazilian trafficking bust
item.description: Brazilian authorities say they have disrupted a major animal trafficking ring, rescuing hundreds of exotic animals and making dozens of arrests.

item.title: In Donald Trump's America, questions not to the president's liking are met with hostility
item.description: As America enters a dark tunnel of dangerous internal divisions and an increasingly violent public discourse, Donald Trump is escalating his attacks on many of this nation's institutions.

item.title: Australia's first Aboriginal parliamentarian Neville Bonner commemorated with bronze sculpture
item.description: Neville Bonner is honoured as Australia's first Indigenous parliamentarian.

item.title: New WA youth detention centre likely three years away, documents show
item.description: A planned youth prison in Perth for high-risk offenders to replace the notorious Unit 18 could still be three years away and cost at least $50 million more than the initial estimate, previously unseen documents reveal.

item.title: Man charged with murder after bones found in search for Susan Goodwin
item.description: Bones have been found at a Port Lincoln property in the search for the remains of Susan Goodwin, who went missing in Port Lincoln decades ago.

item.title: German suspect in Madeleine McCann case freed from prison
item.description: Christian Brueckner is released from a German prison where he has been serving a seven-year sentence for an unrelated sex crime.

item.title: Australia refusing to panic over Pat Cummins's injury ahead of Ashes
item.description: Australia coach Andrew McDonald is confident injured captain Pat Cummins will be fit to play a major role in the men's Ashes, even if he does not feature in all five matches of the series.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Hasan Piker opens up on Charlie Kirk's death, Donald Trump and Elon Musk's campaign against him
item.description: Prominent left-wing commentator Hasan Piker opens up to 7.30 on Donald Trump's left-wing crackdown, the Charlie Kirk he knew and attempts to have him deplatformed.

item.title: Gout Gout, Torrie Lewis, reach semifinal of 200m at the 2025 World Athletics Championships
item.description: Gout Gout powers home to claim third place in his heat and secure a spot in the 200m semifinals at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, after Torrie Lewis ran a PB to reach the semifinals.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate target will strike a middle path. Will it be enough?
item.description: Australia's next major climate commitment will be more ambitious than New Zealand's and Canada's, but less than the United Kingdom's, as the government strikes a middle path in pursuit of an "achievable" 2035 target.

item.title: Why rower Jean Mitchell got an Olympic rings tattoo over her chemo scar
item.description: Making it to the Paris 2024 Olympics was a career highlight for Jean Mitchell — and the brain cancer survivor marked the achievement in a special way.

item.title: Fears human rights activist Aung San Suu Kyi could 'die' in a 'hellhole' prison
item.description: One of the world's most recognised pro-democracy activists needs urgent medical care as she serves a 27-year sentence in a "hellhole" prison, her son has claimed.

item.title: Coal miner Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane, Bowen Basin
item.description: Mining giant Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane and the Bowen Basin in the wake of BHP Mitsubishi Alliance axing 750 workers.

item.title: Northern WA communities already adapting to extreme climate future
item.description: Locals in small northern WA communities say the potential dangers identified by the Climate Risk Assessment are already starting to appear.

item.title: The Sydneysiders saving thousands by leaving the city on 'financial gap year'
item.description: As Sydneysiders struggle with the soaring cost of living, a teacher has found financial freedom thousands of kilometres away, while a digital marketer swaps the city for the bush to save up $100,000.

item.title: Gout Gout shows class to reach 200m semifinal at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Gout Gout could have been rattled competing against some of the world's best in the 200m at the World Athletics Championships, but powered through with an assured display beyond his years.

item.title: Rural citizen scientists monitor wildlife activity to help conservation
item.description: Citizen scientists have collected more than 1.4 million photos and 15,000 hours of audio recordings to help shape the future of conservation management.

item.title: Gaming history goes on display with Australian titles Hollow Knight Silksong and Team Fortress chronicled
item.description: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia loses second ODI to India by record runs margin ahead of Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: A 102-run thumping, the biggest loss by runs for Australia's women's team, sets up a thrilling ODI series decider in India ahead of the Cricket World Cup.

item.title: How youth orchestras foster lifelong friendships and open career pathways for musicians
item.description: With youth orchestras set to busk on the streets of Sydney and Melbourne this weekend, Australian musicians share how those orchestras helped shape their careers.

item.title: Cairns maternity ward named as exposure site in Far North Queensland measles outbreak
item.description: More locally acquired cases have been confirmed with exposure sites now including Cairns Hospital's maternity ward and areas on the Atherton Tablelands.

item.title: Patient 'devastated' as Sydney's dedicated long COVID clinic to close
item.description: A patient of NSW's first dedicated long COVID clinic in Sydney says she is "devastated" and "bewildered" that it will close at the end of the month.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Live pulled from air by US broadcaster ABC over 'insensitive' Charlie Kirk comments
item.description: The late-night talk show's host suggested during a monologue earlier this week that Charlie Kirk's alleged killer may have been a pro-Trump Republican.

item.title: What time does Gout Gout run tonight? Nicola Olyslagers starts high jump campaign at World Athletics Championships
item.description: The Gout Gout mania continues with his 200m semifinal, Torrie Lewis in the corresponding women's race, and gold medal contenders Nicola Olyslagers and Eleanor Patterson in the high jump.

item.title: Palliative Care Australia art prize inspires conversations about death and grieving
item.description: In its fifth year, Palliative Care Australia's Live Well, Die Well national art prize continues to spark important conversations about dying.

item.title: South Sydney Rabbitohs player Brandon Smith faces court on drug, betting charges
item.description: South Sydney Rabbitohs player Brandon Smith has appeared in a Gold Coast court to face drug supply and illegal betting charges.

item.title: How the Collingwood Magpies are righting the ship this AFLW season
item.description: A year after finishing dead last in the AFLW, the Magpies have started making moves up the ladder thanks to a new approach at both ends of the field.

item.title: Australian cow market at record high as US demand hits 'scary times'
item.description: Australian cow prices are at record highs, but are still way below the United States where beef demand is going "crazy".

item.title: Australia vows to cut emissions 62 to 70 per cent by 2035
item.description: Australia will vow to cut its emissions by 62 to 70 per cent by 2035, lifting its sights further as the world strives to reach net zero emissions by 2050.

item.title: Magpies overlook Bobby Hill for AFL preliminary final against Lions
item.description: Coach Craig McRae reveals he has spoken with Bobby Hill about his chances of playing in the AFL finals, as the Magpies ramp up preparations for Saturday's preliminary final against Lions.

item.title: The AFL is in danger of becoming a 'two-tier competition' as multiple club captains search for the exit door
item.description: Three captains from the AFL's four worst-performing clubs are searching for the exit door. It is the symptom of a player movement era that has left the gap between the AFL's strongest and weakest larger than ever.

item.title: What are the best ways to clean windows and fly screens?
item.description: Windows and fly screens are often the first things we see when we walk into a home, but rarely at the top of the spring-cleaning to-do list. Experts share their tips on the easiest and most effective ways to clean them.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate targets on path to net zero judged by the experts
item.description: After much anticipation, Australia has its new climate targets. Now that the dice have fallen, we consult experts on their assessment of how these targets stack up with what’s at stake.

item.title: Son, 28, charged with murder after allegedly assaulting parents on Father's Day
item.description: A 28-year-old Coffs Harbour man has been charged with murder and attempted murder after allegedly assaulting his parents and starting a house fire on Father's Day.

item.title: Amid Trump's biggest, best state visit ever, the king delivers a pointed message
item.description: Amid the diamonds, whisky sours and flattery of a royal banquet for Donald Trump's state visit, tiara diplomacy was on full display.

item.title: Cats coach Chris Scott regrets run-in with AFL staffer after qualifying final
item.description: Geelong coach Chris Scott says long-held frustration with the AFL was behind his regrettable post-qualifying final win outburst at a junior league employee.

item.title: Disability employment provider Bedford's financial situation concerns SA, federal government
item.description: The federal disability minister says his concerns about Australia's second-largest disability employment provider, Bedford, have grown.

item.title: Family of Aboriginal man killed in Darwin hit-and-run speak out over driver's sentence
item.description: The family of an Aboriginal man killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out about the sentence handed to the man who killed him, and the "racist, dehumanising" messages he sent afterwards.

item.title: Albanese to meet with Trump after returning from Pacific empty-handed
item.description: This week in politics, the prime minister returned home from the Pacific empty-handed and the climate debate continued to unsettle the Coalition.

item.title: National Gathering backs plans for new First Nations body, but tensions remain
item.description: First Nations leaders have endorsed plans for a new national representative body to be established. Here’s what we know.

item.title: WA coal phase-out uncertainty amid Bluewaters power station closure backflip
item.description: Efforts by WA's government to force the premature closure of a privately owned coal plant appear to be unravelling after the market operator backed the power station to keep running towards the end of the decade.

item.title: Henley residents advised to keep windows, doors closed amid algal bloom crisis
item.description: Authorities have told a group of residents living near a metropolitan Adelaide beach to close their doors and windows to prevent symptoms related to South Australia's ongoing algal bloom.

item.title: The Albanese government has learned from the last major climate commitment
item.description: The government is keenly aware that the cost of the transition is a sensitive issue, which is why the prime minister was flanked not just by his climate minister but also his treasurer.

item.title: Roosters hand Victor Radley 10-match ban for bringing NRL club into disrepute
item.description: The Sydney Roosters suspend Victor Radley for 10 matches without pay following media revelations he allegedly requested an illegal substance from former teammate Brandon Smith.

item.title: Bindi Magic art exhibition opens in Alice Springs as organisation celebrates 25 years
item.description: For 25 years Bindi Mwerre Anthurre Artists has been helping people with a disability to communicate through creativity.

item.title: Ry Jacob Nairn charged with murder after body found in Northampton
item.description: Ry Jacob Nairn has faced Geraldton Magistrates Court over the death of a 69-year-old man in Northampton earlier this week.

item.description: Gout Gout and Torrie Lewis have missed the final of the 200m, both running to a hugely respectable fourth place in their semifinals.

item.description: In a statement, the IDF said a person "arrived in a truck transporting humanitarian aid from Jordan, and opened fire".

item.description: Prominent leaders in the Democratic Party are accusing the US's communications regulator of "bullying" a network to take the long-running late night show off air.

item.title: AI-generated minister addresses Albanian parliament for first time
item.description: The world's first AI government minister was appointed last week by Albania's prime minister to oversee decisions on public tenders and to ease voter concerns about corruption.

item.description: The CGT trade union claims more than a million people took part in demonstrations, while police say more than 90 people have been detained.

item.title: UK prime minister urges Trump to pressure Putin amid escalating 'recklessness'
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer says recent incidents, including Russian drones' incursion in Poland, show the Russian president is not "someone who wants peace".

item.title: Independent advice spells out mammoth task ahead for government to reach 2035 target
item.description: Getting to even the bottom end of the government's 62 to 70 per cent emissions reduction target by 2035 will require drastic increases to solar and wind power capacity, electric vehicle take-up and an extension of the safeguard mechanism, according to the Climate Change Authority.

item.title: After deadly floods in Bali, its people want answers. Many are blaming overtourism
item.description: Unexpected and deadly flooding rocked Bali last week at a scale many had never experienced before. In the wake of this disaster, the search for answers has begun.

item.title: The climate conversation is stuck in a loop, but out in the world things are changing
item.description: We don't have to wait for moonshot technologies to reach our climate targets. Most of the solutions to the climate crisis are already around us.

item.title: Ukraine could face waves of 2,000 drones as Russia ramps up mass production
item.description: Ukraine is struggling to defend against growing drone attacks, and with Russia's mass production factories in full-swing there are fears thousands will soon be launched in a single night.

item.title: First Guardian, Shield superannuation disasters expose deep flaws in Australia's $4.3 trillion retirement system
item.description: The failed First Guardian and Shield schemes have cost about 12,000 Australians more than $1 billion in retirement savings and exposed deep flaws in how Australia's $4.3 trillion superannuation sector is regulated.

item.title: Therapists, patients raise concerns over The Hobart Clinic closure with fears it could be 'dangerous' for some
item.description: For more than four decades, The Hobart Clinic has provided private mental health services to clients. Since the announcement of its October closure, clinic staff, therapists and patients have warned of the negative impact on those reliant on the service.

item.description: Gout Gout's promise and progress are on full display at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by showing patience, he could get even better.

item.description: Property experts say a "dizzying" report forecasting the impacts of worsening climate conditions on Australian properties has sounded a clear warning for the sector.

item.title: Parents call for football club culture change after death of 21-year-old son
item.description: Steven Callanan had the world at his feet and loved footy like it was a religion. The talented player could bring together communities while he played, but after a night of partying he took his own life.

item.description: The Queensland government has been unrepentant in its tough stance on drugs, with Health Minister Tim Nicholls telling state parliament this week it doesn't "support drug dealers", writes Janelle Miles.

item.description: Visitors flocking to Queensland's Darling Downs for the annual Carnival of Flowers in Toowoomba are advised to take an umbrella, with thunderstorms forecast for the region.

item.description: Nearly a quarter of all western NSW Rural Fire Service volunteers are older than 70, but some younger recruits are urging others to follow in their footsteps.

item.description: The state-owned utility says advice that Port Hedland does not have enough water available to support major development was given in error.

item.description: A push to earn the public's trust over a defence hub south of Perth by the Australian Submarine Agency draws protesters and sceptical residents in Fremantle.

item.title: Israel faces pressure over Gaza ahead of General Assembly as United Nations confronts its own identity crisis
item.description: The UN's role in areas beyond diplomacy, such as in humanitarian aid and refugees, cultural heritage, health, and climate, are all under assault from savage budget cuts.

item.title: Climate risks report paints grim picture, but expert on societal collapse explains giving up is not the answer
item.description: Lethal heat, mosquito-borne viruses, mass displacement and conflict — we got a glimpse into a grim climate future. Can imagining the end of the world be good for us, or is it a path to apathy?

item.title: The inside story of an ABC report that helped scuttle Australia's biggest foreign takeover
item.description: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

item.title: Afghan refugees in Pakistan facing deportation amid local crackdown and Australian visa delays
item.description: After fleeing Afghanistan, many refugees in Pakistan are at risk of being deported back amid a crackdown on temporary cardholders as they wait for humanitarian visas from Australia.

item.title: Senator calls for 'heads on spikes' to deter superannuation mismanagement
item.description: As questions mount about how Australia's retirement funds industry is regulated, a senator says regulator ASIC must more quickly and forcefully enforce the law.

item.title: How Jess Hull's 800m 'side quest' could see her stun at the 2025 World Athletics Championships
item.description: Jess Hull was concerned that a focus on the 800m was potentially hurting her endurance. Instead, her "side quest" could lead to a second world championship medal.

item.title: Investigation of eye-maker's online presence reveals multiple red flags
item.description: A reverse-image search of ocularist Jack McDonald's website shows that receptionist "Nadia" also appears on a dentistry blog and is known as "Donna" on a self-help guru's site. It's just one of the red flags that ABC NEWS Verify spotted during its investigation.

item.title: Technology is driving a quiet revolution in the way players relate to golf
item.description: Virtual golf venues are popping up en masse, as the sport adapts to suit the players of a new era.

item.title: Donald Trump's historic second state visit to the UK was filled with risks for Keir Starmer. Did it pay off?
item.description: Britain rolled the dice on an historic second state visit for the US president in a year of domestic and international political turmoil. It found out where its relationship with Washington was at.

item.title: Monash IVF pauses donor treatments in NSW as it conducts review of patient records
item.description: Patients have been left blindsided by Monash IVF's decision to temporarily halt treatments using donated eggs and sperm in New South Wales.

item.title: Collingwood and Brisbane meet again, two years on from classic 2023 grand final, for tantalising rematch
item.description: The 2023 grand final will go down as one of the best deciders in AFL history, and though the stakes are only marginally lower two years on, the numbers suggest Collingwood and Brisbane's 2025 preliminary final could be another classic.

item.title: Woman's snake bite death in Katherine sparks warnings against complacency
item.description: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

item.title: Pink Floyd's album and ode to Syd Barrett Wish You Were Here turns 50
item.description: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

item.title: New seller disclosure laws expected to redefine property deals in Queensland
item.description: Solicitors are charging anywhere from $300 up to $1,000 to help fill out a form required under the state's new laws, according to a Brisbane buyer's agent and law expert.

item.title: Labor reshuffles its furniture as the Liberals try to save what’s left
item.description: Two resigning ministers, two major broken promises and an unfolding ecological crisis confront SA Labor six months out from a state election. Yet it's the Liberal Party staring down electoral punishment.

item.title: The contenders in the race to replace outgoing NSW Police Commissioner Karen Webb
item.description: The looming decision on who will be the next NSW police commissioner may be one of the biggest of Chris Minns's tenure.

item.title: Judge throws out Donald Trump's multi-billion-dollar New York Times lawsuit
item.description: The US president's $US15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times has been labelled "improper" by a federal judge.

item.title: NSW RFS provides tips on preparing your home for bushfires
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: What time does the F1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix start? How can I watch it?
item.description: Oscar Piastri returns to the streets of Baku — one year on from a terrific victory — holding a 31-point lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

item.title: Freezing rain or 12,000km away, these green Vikings will do anything for their beloved Canberra Raiders
item.description: Simon Tayoun's been a devout member of the Green Army since he watched his first-ever game of rugby league in 1987, and now he's become an unofficial mascot by bringing his custom drum to every game he can to lead the Viking Clap.

item.title: Perth family endure cold, wet winter in bus amid worsening housing crisis
item.description: A Perth man who has been sleeping rough in a bus with his family for the past three years wonders if he would be better off with a roof over his head and regular meals in jail.

item.title: Storm damage sees shark net installation delay at Sydney's Shark Beach in Nielsen Park
item.description: Shark Beach in Sydney's east is seasonally netted with an enclosure to protect swimmers from sharks during Sydney's warmer months — but for the upcoming school holidays, it is unlikely the nets will be installed in time.

item.title: Remote NSW council holds election after 12 years in administration
item.description: The 700 voters living in the remote Central Darling Shire Council area of New South Wales will finally head to the polls to vote again.

item.title: Tasmania's tree fern trade accused of 'greenwashing' over native forest logging links, but others say it is sustainable
item.description: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

item.title: Charlie Kirk’s murder sparks calls for revenge | If You're Listening
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Chelsea FC Women's star Sam Kerr presented with special football to mark 100 goals for club
item.description: Sam Kerr is honoured with a special football to mark her 100 goals for Chelsea — and she can't stop smiling since the landmark strike.

item.title: Victor Caulfield moved to Florence in his 70s and became an artists' model
item.description: Victor Caulfield packed up his Australian home and moved to Italy, where he fell into the art scene as an accidental model.

item.title: British couple freed from Afghanistan's Taliban
item.description: The couple, who ran a charity in Afghanistan where they had lived for 18 years, were freed after months of negotiations with the Taliban by Qatar in coordination with Britain.

item.title: South Australians reflect on life, 50 years after homosexuality was decriminalised
item.description: Since homosexuality was decriminalised in South Australia half a century ago, LGBTIQA+ people say the state has made strides, but there is still some way to go towards equality.

item.title: One-tray honey chicken wings are an easy family dinner - ABC News
item.description: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

item.title: More than 800 Indonesian students get food poisoning from free school meals
item.description: Over 800 students fall sick in two cases of mass food poisoning in one week after consuming free school meals sponsored by the Indonesian government.

item.title: Kianga coal mine tragedy 50 years later and the reforms that followed
item.description: Half a century after the Kianga mine explosion killed 13 workers in central Queensland, a community gathers to remember the tragedy as survivors and experts raise fresh concerns about ongoing safety risks.

item.title: 'America is not happy': ABC under fire for pulling Jimmy Kimmel Live!
item.description: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

item.title: Wide Bay affordable housing estate scrapped due to 'unfeasible' costs
item.description: A controversial housing estate that would have been built on 26 hectares of Bundaberg's green space has been scrapped.

item.title: Canada beats New Zealand 34-19 to reach Women's Rugby World Cup final
item.description: A changing of the guard in women's rugby union as two-time defending world champions New Zealand is beaten for the first time at the tournament since 2014 by a brilliant Canadian side.

item.title: Victorian apiarists finding it harder to access public land 'vital' for bees
item.description: Apiarists are concerned they are losing access to public land in Victoria that provides a critical food source for their hives.

item.title: Near-blinded police officer reunites with those who saved him after rural motorcycle crash
item.description: Police officer John Kenworthy returns to thank the first responders in Mackay, and others who were with him in his darkest moments, after a rural motorcycle crash.

item.description: This is the third fatal strike the US military has carried out this month on a vessel allegedly carrying drugs.

item.title: World-first turtle tracking reveals secrets of flatback turtles in WA's Roebuck Bay
item.description: GPS tracking, motion sensors and video cameras reveal where flatback turtles in Broome's Roebuck Bay feed and travel, contributing to a richer understanding of the vulnerable species.

item.description: Optus reveals it received an early warning of Thursday's system failure — which has since been linked to a fourth death — hours before the situation was fixed, but that it did not respond appropriately to complaints from concerned customers.

item.title: Canberra Raiders receive NRL semifinal blow, losing five-eighth Ethan Strange to illness
item.description: Canberra Raiders are forced to reshuffle their team on the morning of the semifinal against Cronulla after illness struck wunderkind Ethan Strange.

item.title: Teenager pleads guilty to manslaughter over Hobart waterfront drowning
item.description: Deepinderjeet Singh was sitting with a woman near Franklin Wharf in Hobart in late January 2024 when a 17-year-old boy pushed the pair into the water and stole the woman's handbag.

item.title: Critical incident declared after man dies during alleged DV arrest in Sydney's south west
item.description: Police were called to two separate domestic-related incidents in New South Wales overnight.

item.title: UN says there's evidence organised crime scam centres are moving from South-East Asia into new frontier of the Pacific
item.description: As scam centres run by organised crime find it harder to operate in South-East Asia, evidence emerges of them moving into the Pacific and setting up lucrative operations estimated to net billions each year.

item.title: Kamala Harris's frustration with Joe Biden, and other takeaways from her election trail memoir
item.description: Kamala Harris has kept a low profile since losing the US election, but she has plenty to say in her upcoming book — a diary from her doomed campaign.

item.title: Transition from sheep to cropping in WA's Avon Valley leaving limited balloon landing sites
item.description: The move out of sheep by an increasing number of WA farmers is having an unexpected impact on the state's hot air balloon pilots.

item.title: Yolŋu people celebrate 50 years of the homelands movement in East Arnhem Land
item.description: Yolŋu children from nine Laynhapuy communities are screaming the Yothu Yindi anthem, Homeland Movement, in a ceremony celebrating the Indigenous elders who claimed back life on their country 50 years ago.

item.title: Hunter Correctional Centre prisoners refurbish rescue truck for VRA
item.description: The prisoners relished the chance to give back to the community and learn skills that could help to prevent them reoffending.

item.title: Police officer allegedly tasered during arrest in Bathurst, NSW
item.description: A police officer has suffered minor injuries after allegedly being tasered while attempting to carry out an arrest in Bathurst, New South Wales.

item.title: WA Premier Roger Cook says police probing fourth possible death linked to Optus outage
item.description: WA Premier Roger Cook says police are investigating whether a second person in Western Australia died after attempting to call triple-0 during an Optus outage on Thursday.

item.description: When Amina Al-Mufti left the home her family was sheltering in, her parents expected she would quickly return with a bucket full of water. But she never came back.

item.description: Local Government Minister Hannah Beazely condemns the emergence of "extremist" candidates nominating for the state's forthcoming council elections.

item.title: Trump will impose a $150,000 annual fee for H-1B visas. Here's what it means
item.description: Some hope this visa price hike will see the US tech industry prioritise American workers. Others argue it'll dissuade the "world's smartest talent" from choosing to work in the US.

item.title: Kangaroos beat Blues for 18th straight AFLW win as Cats, Hawks and Dockers triumph
item.description: Reigning premiers North Melbourne thrashes Carlton by 53 points, while Port Adelaide is stunned by an umpiring decision in its narrow loss to Geelong.

item.title: Crowds flock to Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers despite wet weather
item.description: Cold and damp conditions have not been enough to keep people away from Toowoomba's annual floral extravaganza.

item.description: The Brisbane Lions advance to a third consecutive season decider where they will face Geelong after defeating Collingwood by 29 points.

item.description: Cronulla keeps its season alive by defeating North Queensland, as Newcastle advances to a fourth NRLW preliminary final.

item.title: NRL finals updates: Cronulla Sharks defeat Canberra Raiders 32-12 in semifinal
item.description: The Canberra Raiders have become the first NRL minor premier to be eliminated from the finals in straight sets, going down to the Cronulla Sharks in a sudden-death semifinal. Follow live.

item.title: Queensland's measles outbreak growing after case confirmed in rural town Middlemount
item.description: A rural town in central Queensland is the latest community affected, after a case was recorded in Middlemount.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan qualifying: Oscar Piastri crashes out in Baku, Max Verstappen secures pole
item.description: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri crashed out of qualifying in Azerbaijan, but his teammate and championship rival Lando Norris was unable to make the Australian pay.
